Weather Wisdom Blog

1-2 feet of snow Friday

A blizzard watch is now in effect for much of eastern Massachusetts as a storm is expected to dump about 1 to 2 feet of snow in the area, David Epstein writes. (3:30 p.m.)
  • Travel may become nearly impossible Friday
  • Watch WBZ forecast  |  Storm Center  |  Details
  • Pictures Blizzard of '78, then and now
  • More photos | '78 storm crippled area | More on Blizzard
Huge storm may bring 2 feet of snow

Brown in talks to appear on Fox News

Scott Brown, who said he would not run in a special election to return to the US Senate, is in negotiations with the news channel, a Fox spokesperson said. (4:44 p.m.)
  • Loading comments... | Add yours Share now:
  • Brown joins firm's board  |  2/1 Opts out of Senate run

Liquidator set for closed sleep centers

Sleep HealthClinics closed last month, citing financial trouble partly resulting from changes in how health insurers pay for sleep-disorder testing. (5:19 p.m.)
  • 1/25 All 19 Sleep HealthCenters clinics close abruptly

Boy Scouts delay decision on gays

Faced with intense pressure from two flanks, the Boy Scouts of America said it needed more time for consultations before deciding whether to move away from its policy of excluding gays as scouts or adult leaders. (1:56 p.m.)
  • Two Scouting families; opposite views on gay ban

marijuana in Mass.

There are two things that can stop Patriots star Rob Gronkowski: injuries and himself. They crashed together on the floor of a Las Vegas nightclub this week.

Bias alleged in Google’s ad results

A research project concludes that searches of names more likely associated with black people often yielded ads for a criminal records search in that person’s name.
Opinion | Jeff Jacoby

The Bay State’s plan for tax giveaways for Broadway-bound shows won’t work.

London looking for the ‘MIT magic’

British officials are studying the success of Kendall Square and the influence of MIT as they try to turn London into a global technology center.
Opinion | Scot Lehigh

GOP candidates commit — almost

Kudos to Dan Winslow and Gabriel Gomez, the two Republicans in this state willing to join the race for US Senate. Apparently willing, anyway.
